etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From steek + -ing

definitions: The closing or shutting of something.

etymologies: 1980s; earliest use found in Threads Magazine. From either steek or steek + -ing

definitions: The action, process, or technique of working a section of extra stitches in a knitted item at a point which will ultimately be cut open; the creation of a steek.
The action of cutting open the steek of a knitted item; the cutting and finishing of a steeked edge in a garment or piece of knitting.
